title: Breaking News: French President Emmanuel Macron to Visit India Next Month After Key AI Talks with EAM S. Jaishankar
description: A major diplomatic update is coming in as India’s External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar met French President Emmanuel Macron, making the interaction highly significant ahead of Macron’s proposed visit to India next month. The meeting focused on advancing the Artificial Intelligence agreement reached between India and France, with both nations expressing commitment to deepen cooperation in emerging technologies. Visuals from the meeting show EAM Jaishankar and President Macron engaging in discussions at the same time these developments were underway. The talks gain importance as President Macron is scheduled to travel to India in the coming month, where further progress on AI collaboration and broader strategic ties is expected. This meeting ahead of the visit underlines the growing strength of India–France relations and their shared vision on responsible and forward-looking AI governance.

title: I grew up gaming — here’s why Sony’s AI gameplay plan worries me
description: Sony’s AI patent could let PlayStation games solve puzzles or beat bosses for you. Gamers are split on whether that helps — or ruins the fun.

title: A Look At Cipher Mining (CIFR) Valuation As It Pivots To AI Data Centers With Long Term AWS Deal
description: Cipher Mining (CIFR) is drawing fresh attention after shifting its focus from pure bitcoin mining to hosting AI and high performance computing clients, supported by a long term Amazon Web Services agreement and new senior hires. title: How Analyst Focus on AI Monetization and Upmarket Expansion Will Impact monday.com (MNDY) Investors
description: In recent days, analysts at Jefferies, Citi, and BTIG updated their views on monday.com, emphasizing its focus on AI monetization, expansion beyond core work management, and resilience amid a cautious software demand backdrop. Across these reports, a common thread is monday.com's push upmarket and into additional product areas, which could meaningfully influence how investors think about its long-term growth mix and customer base.
